Quotes: A letter does not blush.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: I'm not going to get into the ring with Tolstoy.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: I never had to choose a subject - my subject rather chose me.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Writing and travel broaden your ass if not your mind and I like to write standing up.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: I learned never to empty the well of my writing, but always to stop when there was still something there in the deep part of the well, and let it refill at night from the springs that fed it.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: A serious writer is not to be confounded with a solemn writer. A serious writer may be a hawk or a buzzard or even a popinjay, but a solemn writer is always a bloody owl.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: When writing a novel a writer should create living people;people not characters. A character is a caricature.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: We are much beholden to Machiavel and others, that write what men do, and not what they ought to do.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: There are heroes in evil as well as in good.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: The best author will be the one who is ashamed to become a writer.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: I think that the idea that I'm writing for many more people than I ever imagined has created a certain general responsibility that is literary and political. There's even pride involved, in not wanting to fall short of what I did before.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: Syllables govern the world.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Reading made Don Quixote a gentleman, but believing what he read made him mad.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Good writing is like a windowpane.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Dickens is one of those authors who are well worth stealing.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: I undertake the same project as Montaigne, but with an aim contrary to his own: for he wrote his Essays only for others, and I write my reveries only for myself.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: Ordinary readers, forgive my paradoxes: one must make them when one reflects;and whatever you may say, I prefer being a man with paradoxes than a man with prejudices.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: I should be very willing to redress men wrongs, and rather check than punish crimes, had not Cervantes, in that all too true tale of Quixote, shown how all such efforts fail.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: A fashionable milieu is one in which everybody's opinion is made up of the opinion of all the others. Has everybody a different opinion? Then it is a literary milieu.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: Biographies are but the clothes and buttons of the man. The biography of the man himself cannot be written.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: She was not quite what you would call refined. She was not quite what you would call unrefined. She was the kind of person that keeps a parrot.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: All which is not prose is verse;and all which is not verse is prose.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: Grammar, which knows how to control even kings.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Mr. Henry James writes fiction as if it were a painful duty.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: It took me 40 years to write my first book.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: It's very difficult to read a book on your computer.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: My readers - and I get 400 emails for a day, my readers normally they say, well, you understand me, and I answer, you do understand me also. We are in the same level.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Publishing is in a kind of Jurassic age.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Today, writers want to impress other writers.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: You should treat a muse like a fairy.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: I had this dream to become a writer since I was a teenager.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: You drown not by falling into a river, but by staying submerged in it.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: You fail only if you stop writing.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: Without libraries what have we? We have no past and no future.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: The poet gives us his essence, but prose takes the mold of the body and mind.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: A good essay must have this permanent quality about it;it must draw its curtain round us, but it must be a curtain that shuts us in not out.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Nothing induces me to read a novel except when I have to make money by writing about it. I detest them.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: Lord, Lord, how subject we old men are to this vice of lying!
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Now is the winter of our discontent.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: I dote on his very absence.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: To be, or not to be, that is the question.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: If to do were as easy as to know what were good to do, chapels had been churches, and poor men's cottage princes' palaces.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: How well he's read, to reason against reading!
Author: William Shakespeare
